conclusion: Need to determine total displacement and total distance traveled to find average velocity and speed.
Particle moves along two semi-circular arcs with radius 1 m.
Length of one semi-circular arc is calculated as πR.
Length of each semi-circular arc is π m.
Displacement is the shortest distance between initial and final positions.
Particle starts at point A and ends at point C.
Displacement is the diameter of a full circle with radius 1 m, which is 2 m.
Average velocity is total displacement divided by total time.
Average velocity is 0.4 m/s in the eastward direction.
Average speed is total distance traveled divided by total time.
Average speed is 2π/5 m/s, approximately 1.26 m/s.
Final answers: Average velocity is 0.4 m/s east, average speed is 2π/5 m/s.
